text: Coatbridge and Chryston was a constituency represented in the House of Commons of the Parliament of the United Kingdom. It returned one Member of Parliament (MP) from 1997 until 2005. It was then replaced by the Coatbridge, Chryston & Bellshill constituency. ==Boundaries== The Monklands District electoral divisions of Coatbridge North and East, and Coatbridge South; and the Strathkelvin District electoral division of Chryston. == Members of Parliament == {| class="wikitable" |- !colspan="2"|Election!!Member!!Party |- |style="background-color: " | | 1997 | Tom Clarke | Labour |- |colspan="2" align="center"|2005 |colspan="2"| constituency abolished: see Coatbridge, Chryston & Bellshill |} == Election results == ===Elections of the 2000s=== ===Elections of the 1990s=== ==References== * ;Specific Category:Historic parliamentary constituencies in Scotland (Westminster) Category:United Kingdom Parliamentary constituencies established in 1997 Category:United Kingdom Parliamentary constituencies disestablished in 2005 Category:Politics of North Lanarkshire Category:Coatbridge
title: Coatbridge and Chryston (UK Parliament constituency)
